column4: can anyone tell me how to add a port (printer ip address) please?
is the printer connected via some network device (like a jetdirect interface)?
the printer has a built in nic, and is connected from that to a router... and my computer to that router
I can use it with a windows machine... so the printer itself is setup
does it use IPP or SMB in windows?
I just told windows to use the ip address that the printer gave itself...
sorry I didnt tell it either... ok just a sec
i meant i don't know which of the network printing protocols windows is using for your particular printer
can I somehow try whaterver is available?
sure, just use the printer setup gui and fill in as much info as you can... just select networked-printer and go for it
so what would a URI be?
or for that matter, what would a SBM number or whatever look like?
i can't help you if you don't know what your printer uses, sorry.  from what you have told me, your printer is not using SMB.  so it's either IPP or LPR
if there is some sort of config interface for your printer (like a web interface) that would help [you]  a lot
ok so if it were LPR what number or name... would I be looking for?
no, does ubuntu not do that by default?
no.  most distro's don't.  just grab it from sun's site
